IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ESTABLISHED IN 1922, THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION IS "TO UNITE PEOPLE, IDEAS AND RESOURCES TO IMPROVE LIVES" IN THE CITY OF BROCKTON AND TWENTY ONE TOWNS IN GREATER PLYMOUTH COUNTY. THE ORGANIZATION ENVISIONS A SAFE, HEALTHY AND WELL EDUCATED COMMUNITY WHERE PEOPLES' NEEDS ARE MET EFFECTIVELY, RESPECTFULLY AND COMPASSIONATELY AND FOCUSES ITS EFFORTS ON EDUCATION, HEALTH AND INCOME.
IRS990.MissionDesc: ESTABLISHED IN 1922, THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION IS "TO UNITE PEOPLE, IDEAS AND RESOURCES TO IMPROVE LIVES" IN THE CITY OF BROCKTON AND TWENTY ONE TOWNS IN GREATER PLYMOUTH COUNTY. THE ORGANIZATION ENVISIONS A SAFE, HEALTHY AND WELL EDUCATED COMMUNITY WHERE PEOPLES' NEEDS ARE MET EFFECTIVELY, RESPECTFULLY AND COMPASSIONATELY AND FOCUSES ITS EFFORTS ON EDUCATION, HEALTH AND INCOME.
IRS990.Desc: IN ITS KEY ROLE AS A COMMUNITY CONVENER, UNITED WAY OF GREATER PLYMOUTH COUNTY SERVES AS A NEUTRAL FACILITATOR, ARBITER, AND BROKER OF PARTNERSHIPS THAT GENERATE AND UTILIZE FINANCIAL AND HUMAN RESOURCES IN AN EFFICIENT AND EFFECTIVE MANNER TO PROVIDE SYSTEMATIC CHANGES IN A COMMUNITY THAT WILL IMPROVE THE LIVES OF OUR RESIDENTS. THE MOST URGENT NEEDS ARE IDENTIFIED THROUGH CONVERSATIONS WITH CITIZENS, COMMUNITY SERVICES PROVIDERS AND COMMUNITY LEADERS. PUBLIC INFORMATION CAMPAIGNS ARE THEN CONDUCTED AT OVER 200 AREA BUSINESSES IN ORDER TO GENERATE FINANCIAL PLEDGES AND GIFTS TO MEET THESE URGENT NEED. OVER 40 VOLUNTEERS ARE RECRUITED FROM THE COMMUNITY TO REVIEW APPLICATIONS FROM AREA NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS PROPOSING PROGRAMS AND INITIATIVES WITH MEASUREABLE OUTCOMES THAT WILL HAVE A POSITIVE COMMUNITY IMPACT FOR THOSE WHO ARE MOST IN NEED IN THE COMMUNITY. VOLUNTEERS REVIEW, CONDUCT SITE VISITS AND RATE THE QUALITY OF APPLICATIONS, CONCENTRATING ON THOSE THAT ARE MOST EFFECTIVE THROUGH COLLABORATION AND CREATIVE PARTNERSHIPS TO ADDRESS THE MAJOR NEED AREAS OF EDUCATION, HEALTH AND INCOME.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: UNITED WAY OF GREATER PLYMOUTH COUNTY CURRENTLY HOLDS TWO INTERRELATED CONTRACTS WITH THE MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF CHILDREN AND FAMILIES FOR COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS OF BROCKTON AND FOR THE FAMILY RESOURCE CENTER BOTH GEARED TO PROVIDING INFORMATION AND REFERRAL SERVICES TO PARENTS AND THEIR CHILDREN IN ORDER TO REDUCE CHILD ABUSE AND NEGLECT. MANY EDUCATIONAL AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES FOR PARENTS ARE CONDUCTED AFTER SCHOOL ON WEEKENDS AND DURING HOLIDAYS AND SCHOOL VACATION BREAKS. THE CCB AND FRC GENERATE A MONTHLY NEWSLETTER AND RESOURCE GUIDE, BOTH PRINTED AND ONLINE, AS WELL AS A QUARTERLY PARENT'S MAGAZINE WRITTEN AND PUBLISHED BY AND FOR FAMILIES AND THEIR CHILDREN. THESE INNOVATIVE PROGRAMS HAVE BECOME THE "HUB OF ACTIVITY" FOR PARENTS, AS WELL AS A MECHANISM TO EMPOWER PARENTS TO TAKE ON LEADERSHIP ROLES IN THE COMMUNITY.

BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA MAYFLOWER COUNCIL

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS A SYSTEM OF BOTH AWARDING AND MONITORING OF GRANTEES. THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVES WITH EACH APPLICATION THE AGENCY'S IRS FORM 990S AND MOST RECENT AUDITS, FOR REVIEW BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE. EACH APPLICANT IS REQUIRED TO PROVIDE THE ORGANIZATION WITH THEIR 501(C)3 STATUS, CERTIFICATION INDICATING COMPLIANCE WITH THE SPIRIT AND INTENT OF THE USA PATRIOT ACT AND OTHER COUNTERTERRORISM LAWS AS REQUESTED, AND THAT ALL STAFF AND/OR VOLUNTEERS WORKING DIRECTLY WITH CLIENTS HAVE BEEN PROPERLY CORIED. AS PART OF THE RFP PACKET, THE APPLICANTS TELL HOW THEY ARE GOING TO ADDRESS THE NEED AREA AND THEY PROVIDE A PROPOSED BUDGET FOR THE INITIATIVE. AT THE END OF THEIR CALENDAR YEAR THEY MUST PROVIDE A YEAR END REPORT THAT EXPLAINS WHAT THEY ACCOMPLISHED AND NUMBER OF CLIENTS SERVED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SUBCOMMITTEES ARE NOT EMPOWERED TO ACT ON BEHALF OF THE GOVERNING BOARD WITHOUT AN EXPLICIT VOTE OF THE BOARD. NOTES ARE KEPT BUT ARE NOT CONSIDERED PART OF THE OFFICIAL RECORD OF THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A PDF VERSION OF THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY ALL BOARD MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS REVIEWED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS BY THE BOARD WHERE THEY ARE PROVIDED MATERIAL TO FORM AN OPINION ON THE APPROVED LEVEL. COMPENSATION LEVELS FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE PROVIDED TO THE BOARD BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR DURING THE ANNUAL BUDGET REVIEW PROCESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
